explanation: Robotics lag behind software by decades. While AI can design a building, it cannot navigate the chaos of a 1920s crawlspace to retrofit plumbing or HVAC. The 'messy reality' of existing infrastructure is the ultimate moat against automation.

In a world of infinite, perfect fake content (video, audio, documents), 'provenance' becomes the most valuable asset. A business that cryptographically certifies the physical origin of media or products will be essential for courts, news, and high-value commerce.

As 'perfect' AI generation becomes virtually free, imperfection and human effort become luxury status symbols. Brands that can audit and prove their goods (furniture, art, writing) are 100% human-made will command massive premiums, similar to 'organic' food today.

AI agents cannot be sued or held criminally liable. High-stakes industries (medicine, law, structural engineering) will require a human to legally 'sign off' on AI work to absorb liability. This business sells the license and insurance wrapper for AI output.

As the digital world becomes hyper-persuasive and addictive, the wealthy will pay a premium for guaranteed 'off-grid' cognitive silence. These are physically shielded spaces for unrecorded, private human interactionâ€”selling 'privacy' as the ultimate luxury experience.

Instead of tech giants harvesting data for free, individuals will use 'Personal AI Agents' to fence their data. This business acts as a bank/broker, negotiating sales of a client's biometric or behavioral data to corporate AI models, turning privacy into an income stream.

While AI can diagnose, it cannot provide the tactile comfort and emotional resonance required at end-of-life. The 'Human Premium' is highest here; families will refuse robotic care for emotional reasons, creating a permanent demand for empathetic human labor.

Digital dating will be overrun by bots and hyper-optimized AI catfishes. Trust in digital introduction will collapse. Physical, vetted, human-run introduction services (for romance, co-founders, or investors) will replace apps as the only trusted network.

As the physical world floods with autonomous delivery bots and drones, they will break constantly. A decentralized network of repair shops (like local mechanic garages) will be needed to fix the hardware that AI software drives but cannot physically mend.

As the internet becomes a 'Dark Forest' of AI noise, people will retreat to hyper-local, verified physical communities (HOAs, clubs, local guilds). Managing the physical and interpersonal politics of these tribes requires high EQ and physical presence.
